application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: Integrating locally learned causal structures with overlapping variables

affiliation.orgName: Carnegie Mellon University & Institute for Human & Machine Cognition Pittsburgh
Carnegie Mellon University & Institute for Human & Machine Cognition Pittsburgh
Carnegie Mellon University & Institute for Human & Machine Cognition Pittsburgh

analytic.title: Integrating locally learned causal structures with overlapping variables

abstract.p: In many domains, data are distributed among datasets that share only some variables ; other recorded variables may occur in only one dataset. While there are asymptotically correct, informative algorithms for discovering causal relationships from a single dataset, even with missing values and hidden variables, there have been no such reliable procedures for distributed data with overlapping variables. We present a novel, asymptotically correct procedure that discovers a minimal equivalence class of causal DAG structures using local independence information from distributed data of this form and evaluate its performance using synthetic and real-world data against causal discovery algorithms for single datasets and applying Structural EM, a heuristic DAG structure learning procedure for data with missing values, to the concatenated data.
